reviewText: My Solar Belly Dance arrived on time and in great condition.  No marks or scartches on the DVD.  I love this DVD and would buy more Solar dances, she is a great dancer and excellent moves!

reviewText: I love everything about this DVD, and Lunar as well. There is so much packed in--a wonderful warm up, practice and drills, meditation, choreography, performance... and there is something for all levels. I have had these DVDs for several months now, and I use them regularly. There are other DVDs that I used a couple of times and have not gone back to.
Title: N/A

reviewText: WHAT IS BETTER THAN IN OTHER DVD's:+ I LOVE the dance combinations; they are probably the ones I like most in my bellydance collection. They are also fun to execute if you master the moves (to fast paced music).+ "Flowing" style: all the DVD is structured in what Sera calls "movement flow", so your practise starts flowing from the beginning. If I would like to learn the dancing style of a particular dancer it would be Sera's style for her flow and intensity or Irina's for her elegance...+ The arms combinations are excellent, the armwork is part of a full body movement that is intense and powerful. These arm combinations are unrivalled in my collection (Of course there are other DVD's with beautiful arm movements likeThe Tribal Fusion Belly Dance Workout, with Irina: A bellydance fitness class of 100% tribal fusion style moves. Includes complete belly dance instructional how-to) but Solar are my favorite. Sera'sFoundations of Bellydance: East Coast Tribal, with Sera Solstice: Beginner belly dance classes, Full instruction, East Coast Tribal Style how-toincludes a very good explanation and practise of the basic arm positions (first, second, third, open third and up to fifth position) lacking in this DVD, since this one is more advanced. However, regarding the practise of arm trajectories I preferBellydance: Beautiful Technique from Step One, with Autumn Ward: Beginner belly dancing classes, Belly dance how-to, Beginner bellydance instructionover Sera's Foundations.+ Instruction & practise for the combinations. Regarding choreographies (not "dance workouts where you have several reps of the same movements), so far I can only handle Sera's. In a real choreography you do not repeat the moves in the various 8-counts, so you need good memory to remember the sequence, but Sera teaches you slowly and then includes enough practise time, first slow, then a bit faster.+ The workout is one of the toughest workouts I have found in bellydance DVD's in terms of cardio and toning. It even might start a bit too fast (watch out for knee injuries); it's like dancing from the beginning. Maybe it's rivalled byModern Tribal Belly Dance, with Asharah: Beginner tribal fusion bellydance how-to, Belly dancing instruction(a bit longer and even tougher in terms of toning, but not in terms of cardio) and Irina's warm-up (a bit shorter).Do you need Sera's "Foundations" DVD in order to do Solar? I am not sure; Foundations' movements are kind of a basis on which to build upon to create "Solar" movements, so it sure helps, since you will have already mastered a fundamental part of the moves. But if I needed to choose between both, I would definitely take Solar (maybe drilling first with other DVD's).CARDIO CHALLENGE: Medium TONING: Medium CHOREOGRAPHY DIFFICULTY: Intermediate to Advanced INSTRUCTIONAL QUALITY: Very good MUSIC: Very good FUN FACTOR: HighCONTENT:1) Warm-up, workout and meditation - Very good warm-up followed by a fast paced and tough workout, your cardio levels go up with toning and "flowing" exercises that will give you more grace and flexibility. I found this section a bit risky, specially the quick lunges, so take care of how you position your knees - even if it takes you longer to make the move. Finally a strange meditation, it is performed sitting and circling around yourself all the time, so it is a "moving" meditation. This segment is almost the same as the one in "Foundations", just adding a few more exercises and modifying some of them to make it a bit more difficult; but it's basically the same.2) Three segments, each breaks down Essential Solar Armwork (with this armwork you kind of guide the movement of your entire body - WOW), Hipwork and then Footwork, Hipwork and Undulations that will be used in the different choreography segments. This is already the basics for the choreography.3) Four choreography segments (air, fire, water and earth), first demonstrated several times and then a step-by-step instruction; to end with a practise section first slow, then at full speed. If I counted correctly, (because Sera does not count the combinations for you), each of the four segments is formed of two 8-counts which are done first to the right and then to the left, but it's the same movements. This is probably the limit of what I can handle in terms of memorizing combinations, I have difficulties with more than three 8-counts in other choreos, but this was doable with certain amount of effort.4) Full choreography (all the segments put together one after the other) and repeated a couple of times so you can practise the entire choreo.5) Cooldown - This cannot be called a cooldown, it's just a couple (very few) movements to slow you down and some very brief back stretches. But at least it slows you down, whereas in "Foundations" there is absolutely no cooldown.6) Two performances by Sera and one by the "Solstice Ensemble" - Beautiful and strong performances that also try to include some of the Solar moves you have learnt to different music and style.MUSIC:Very good choice, modern electronic music that is nice to dance to.EMPHASIS:Good overall emphasis, upper body, lower body, total body and excellent arm combinations too. I would say the emphasis is on achieving "flowing movement" and integrating everything into powerful full body movement.
summary: Powerful and intense full body movement combinations
Title: N/A

reviewText: With Tribal Style Belly Dance in vogue today, I was eager to try " Solar East Coast Tribal Style Belly Dance. " I knew then I have my work cut out for me!  This a total dancer's workshop packed with technique, combos, and conditioning! Designed for the serious dancer,the technique here utilizes much energy and movement with control, and very well defined precision.The program segments:A fantastic warm up which comprise stretches and lunge variations that are typically used in Sera's programs. Those of us who are familiar, know that these are a full body workout and intense. The hip work movement is challenging and designed to strengthen as it is layered on releve and plie.Seated moving meditation follows with upper body circular and undulating movement,and leg extensions.Arm work segment follows with intricate weaving and torso involvement. The arms are articulated at every joint and the result is elegant and sinuous. I felt this section moved too fast and will have to repeat it several times.Tutorial and Combo for all four elements:Air, Fire, Water, Earth: Each element is represented in different combos. The movement here is far from classical belly dance! Here Sera Solstice elaborates the trendy and cutting edge styles of industrial, and hip hop fused seamless ly with belly dance in Sera style, which is her remarkable talent. The combos are danced by Sera and dancers with ample repetitions, and followed with step by step demonstrations, taught by Sera. A great bonus is the practice flow segments. These follow with a lovely cool down and closing with Sera and dancers.Performances: 2 solo performances by Sera;1 by Sera and Solstice Ensemble-too rich for common words!Anyone with entry level fundamentals may venture into this program with infectious enthusiasm and work hard to attain the goals that this program inspires. The intermediate student with a  love for tribal and its developments will probably benefit most from this extraordinary program. I find myself looking forward to Sera's programs because they are rich in technique and the choreographies are amazing!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the sister DVD to Lunar Belly Dance, and, frankly, is even more fun! (But you should get them both because it will add to your repetoire!)  This follows the same format as Lunar but there are more performances at the end, and very enjoyable performances indeed!  The costuming is beautiful and creative, the girls are lovely, and the combinations you will learn will surely spur your own creativity.  This is for intermediates to advanced dancers in the Tribal Fusion style.
summary: Sister DVD to Lunar Belly Dance!
Title: N/A

reviewText: For me, the best part of Sera Soltice's dvds is the warm-up.  I love, love the warm-up on this dvd.  It stretches you out and puts you in the mood to dance.  Even if you are not a belly dancer, get this dvd for the warm-up.  The second best part of this dvd for me was the lower body isolations.  It was awesome.  The music was upbeat and a mix of latin and middle eastern.  The moves were hot.Seir, the previous reviewer did a very good job of breaking down the flow of the dvd. It is the same class setting as her fundamentals dvd with a ton of dancers. (why so many?)  I will add that my favorite routine was Earth becauase it used the same music as the lower body isolations.  The music for the other elements were techno something or the other.  Not my cup of tea.  What is so special about this belly dance dvd is that Sera makes good use of space.  Most belly dance is so compact; just a bunch of isolations.  This choreography uses large and small movements to express the dance.  It feels like a combination of modern dance and belly dance.  Wonderful!! All in all a very good dvd with something for everyone.  Challenging, fun and well worth the effort.  Good job Sera!!
Title: N/A
